name: ESSAI 2026
venue: European Summer School on Artificial Intelligence, Vienna, Austria
description: The 2026 European Summer School on Artificial Intelligence (ESSAI) will take place in Vienna, Austria from 6 to 10 July. It is designed for PhD students and young researchers and provides both introductory and advanced AI courses, tutorials, and a rich social programme. With over 30 lecturers, multiple parallel tracks and networking opportunities, participants can gain a broad view of AI and connect with international experts.

name: OpenEuroLLM Winter School
description: The 2026 Winter School on Multilinguality in LLM Development and Evaluation is organized by the Nordic Language Processing Laboratory and the University of Oslo and will take place at the Skeikampen conference hotel north of Oslo, Norway. It aims to bring together European NLP researchers, especially those from EuroHPC consortium countries, to share expertise on large‑scale multilingual language models, open‑science practices, and high‑performance e‑infrastructure. The program includes technical talks, hands‑on sessions, and a walk‑through of EuroHPC experience reports, with all meals provided and subsidized bus transfers from Oslo Airport.

name: Probabilistic AI School
description: ProbAI School 2026 is a Probabilistic AI School taking place in Vilnius, Lithuania. It aims to provide an inclusive educational environment featuring state-of-the-art expertise in machine learning and artificial intelligence for enthusiasts, students, academics, and industry professionals. The five‑day program runs from August 3 to August 7, 2026, and is co‑organized with the Artificial Intelligence Association of Lithuania.

name: BMVA Computer Vision Summer School
description: The 29th BMVA Computer Vision Summer School will be held at Durham University in Durham, England, UK. It offers an intensive week of lectures and lab sessions covering a broad range of computer‑vision topics presented by leading researchers from the UK and abroad. The programme includes daily oral talks and provides participants with hands‑on experience and networking opportunities.

name: Oxford Machine Learning Summer School 2026
venue: Oxford ML School, Oxford, United Kingdom
description: OxML Summer 2026 is a programme offered by the Oxford ML School that combines in‑person sessions in Oxford with an online component. It provides three specialised tracks covering the latest AI theory and applications, taught by world‑renowned experts from leading academic and industry labs. Participants can customise their learning by selecting any combination of tracks to match their up‑skilling goals.

name: Robotics, Perception and Learning (RPL) Summer School
venue: KTH Royal Institute of Technology, Stockholm, Sweden
description: The RPL Summer School 2026, organized by the Division for Robotics, Perception and Learning at KTH Royal Institute of Technology in Stockholm, Sweden, targets doctoral and postdoctoral researchers. It covers a broad spectrum of topics such as machine learning, computer vision, robotics, human‑robot interaction, planning and decision making, and combines keynote talks with brainstorming and discussion sessions to foster new collaborations. The six‑day event will be held at the Happy Tammsvik resort, offering participants a relaxed setting with nature, spa and outdoor activities, while all accommodation and meals are sponsored.

name: Machine Learning Crash Course at MALGA
description: The MLCC2026 Summer School provides an introduction to the fundamental concepts and algorithms of Machine Learning. It is aimed at undergraduate and graduate students, as well as professionals, and combines theoretical lectures with hands‑on lab sessions conducted in person at the DIBRIS/DIMA building in Genoa. Participants receive university credits and must complete a final test consisting of notebook exercises and a report.

name: UK Robotics Summer School
venue: National Robotarium, Heriot-Watt University, Edinburgh, United Kingdom
description: The UK Robotics Summer School 2026 is a five‑day program held at the National Robotarium, Heriot‑Watt University in Edinburgh, United Kingdom. It offers expert‑led lectures, tutorials and industry talks covering bio‑inspired robotics, healthcare robotics, generative AI, validation of AI methods and real‑world applications. Aimed at master’s‑level students and industry practitioners, the school provides hands‑on experience with state‑of‑the‑art robots and networking opportunities.

name: International Summer School for Advanced Studies on Biometrics, Behavior, and Vision
description: The 2026 Biometrics International Summer School takes place at Hotel Dei Pini in Porto Conte near Alghero, Sardinia, Italy. It focuses on the impact of generative AI and large foundation models on biometric and human‑recognition technologies, covering machine learning, image understanding, signal analysis and related disciplines. The program is aimed at PhD students, post‑docs, researchers and professionals, offering hands‑on lectures by leading experts, optional videoconference participation, and scholarships.

name: 1st Internationa School on the Cognitive, Ethical, and Societal Dimensions of AI - AIces
description: AIces 2026 is the first International School on the Cognitive, Ethical and Societal Dimensions of Artificial Intelligence, held in Porto, Portugal from 30 March to 2 April 2026. The school targets graduate and postgraduate students as well as industry practitioners, offering parallel courses, symposia, and open debates on cognition, ethics, and society in AI. Participants can attend face‑to‑face or online, receive recorded lectures for 45 days, and obtain a certificate of participation.

name: Winter School on Ethical, Legal, and Societal (ELS) aspects of AI and AS at Umeå University
description: The Winter School on Ethical, Legal, and Societal aspects of AI and Autonomous Systems brings together researchers and students to explore the interdisciplinary challenges of responsible AI. It offers a program of lectures, hands‑on multidisciplinary training, a poster session, and a social program to foster networking and professional exchange. The event takes place at Umeå University in Sweden from 11 to 13 March 2026.

name: Winter School on Social Robotics, Artificial Intelligence and Multimedia (SoRAIM 2026)
description: The Winter School on Social Robotics, Artificial Intelligence and Multimedia (SoRAIM) 2026 will be held at the Escandille in Autrans, France. It aims to bring together researchers from fields such as computer vision, speech/audio processing, and human‑robot interaction to foster cross‑disciplinary exchange through courses and informal networking. The program features talks by top‑level experts on topics including affective signal processing, conversational speech synthesis, and multimodal dialogue, set against the backdrop of the Vercors mountains.

name: Machine Learning Summer School (MLSS) Melbourne
venue: Sandridge Events Centre, Port Melbourne, Australia
description: The 2026 Machine Learning Summer School (MLSS) takes place in Melbourne, Australia at the Sandridge Events Centre in Port Melbourne. It targets 50 hand‑picked PhD students and early‑career researchers, offering two weeks of lectures, tutorials and talks covering core theory to post‑LLM research. World‑class speakers from academia and industry present topics such as deep learning, generative modeling, reinforcement learning and AI in industry, with stipends available for selected participants.

name: Northern Lights Deep Learning Winter School
venue: UiT The Arctic University of Norway, Tromsø, Norway
description: The Winter School is part of the Northern Lights Deep Learning Conference 2027 and will be held in Tromsø, Norway. It focuses on deep learning, covering state-of-the-art methods in image classification, object detection, segmentation, time series prediction, and speech recognition. The school aims to bring together researchers to exchange ideas, foster collaborations, and present cutting‑edge research in the field.

name: Annual Nepal AI School (ANAIS)
description: The Sixth Annual Nepal AI School is an 11‑day intensive program offering AI lectures, hands‑on labs, and project work. It targets senior undergraduates, graduate and PhD students, faculty members, and industry professionals from Nepal and abroad. The school aims to provide fundamental and advanced AI knowledge, foster collaborations, and inspire participants to tackle high‑impact AI challenges.

name: EEML Summer School
venue: Eastern European Machine Learning Summer School, Cetinje, Montenegro
description: The Eastern European Machine Learning Summer School takes place in Cetinje, Montenegro from 27 July to 1 August 2026. The program offers lectures and tutorials on modern machine‑learning techniques, featuring speakers and tutorial leads from leading research labs such as Google DeepMind, Mila and the University of Cambridge. It is aimed at students and early‑career researchers in the region and provides networking opportunities with academic and industry partners.

name: Mediterranean Summer School
venue: University of Split Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering and Naval Architecture, Split, Croatia
description: The Mediterranean Machine Learning (M2L) Summer School is a five‑day program held at the University of Split’s Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering and Naval Architecture in Split, Croatia. It provides keynotes, lectures and hands‑on sessions on topics such as computer vision, natural language processing, generative models and reinforcement learning, and encourages participants to present their work in poster sessions. The school targets doctoral and outstanding master students, as well as academics and practitioners from the Mediterranean region, fostering networking and diversity through scholarships and outreach.

name: Summer School on Multimodal Foundation Models and Generative AI
venue: Institut National des Postes et Télécommunications, Rabat, Morocco
description: The AI Summer School on Multimodal Foundation Models and Generative AI is a five‑day immersive program held at the Institut National des Postes et Télécommunications in Rabat, Morocco. It targets young researchers, master’s and Ph.D. students, post‑docs and professionals, offering theoretical lectures, hands‑on labs, and project mentorship on state‑of‑the‑art multimodal and generative AI. The school features expert speakers, networking opportunities, and aims to develop the next generation of AI leaders in Morocco.

name: AthNLP Summer School 2026
description: The Athens Natural Language Processing Summer School 2026 will be held at the NCSR Demokritos campus in Athens, Greece. The program, organized jointly by RC Athena, NCSR Demokritos, Athens University of Economics and Business, and Heriot‑Watt University, focuses on advanced topics in natural language processing. It runs from September 3 to September 9, offering participants intensive lectures and hands‑on sessions, with further details to be announced in the coming weeks.

name: Advanced Artificial Intelligence: GenAI & Deep Unsupervised Learning
venue: Lady Margaret Hall, Oxford, United Kingdom
description: The Advanced Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning summer school focuses on generative AI and deep unsupervised learning techniques. It offers theoretical instruction and hands‑on experience with clustering, GANs, self‑supervised and energy‑based models, targeting STEM students with intermediate AI knowledge. The intensive residential or online program runs from 29 June to 17 July 2026 at Lady Margaret Hall, Oxford, providing career‑relevant skills and a foundation for future research.

name: AI4Science Summer School
description: The 2nd Summer School on Advancing Scientific Discovery with AI is a comprehensive program that explores the intersection of artificial intelligence and scientific research. It targets PhD students, post‑doctoral researchers, and scientists, offering hands‑on workshops and case studies on machine learning, AI‑driven experimental design, generative models, and integration with physical simulations. The event aims to equip participants with deep learning skills and practical experience using Python libraries such as NumPy and PyTorch.

name: LUT Summer School
description: LUT Summer School is a one‑week academic event offering intensive courses on sustainability, climate action, marketing, management, inventive thinking and the intersection of business and technology. The programme combines workshops, classes, group work and a social programme set against the backdrop of Finland’s unspoiled summer nature on the Lappeenranta campus. It targets bachelor’s and master’s students from partner universities, providing 3 ECTS credits per course and a chance to experience Finnish culture while gaining practical, interdisciplinary skills.
